summary: This document is an email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding travel approval requests and logistics for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details planning for an interview trip to Stockholm, Sweden in late January/early February 2020, and references several prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: Coordinates travel logistics (flights, hotels) for the investigation team, communicates with Ed Tyrrell for approval of expenses over per diem.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary requester of travel approvals for the Epstein investigation team, submits multiple requests for trips to conduct interviews in Sweden, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.role: Supervisor/Approving Official (likely Administrative Officer or similar)
persons.context: Approves travel requests and budget overrides for the investigation team, copied on logistical emails.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Member of the investigation team traveling for victim interviews, mentioned as a traveler on multiple trips to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Member of the investigation team traveling for victim interviews, mentioned as a traveler on trips to West Palm Beach and Los Angeles.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on a travel approval email from Edward Tyrrell.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on multiple travel approval request emails.

connections.description: Alex submits travel approval requests to Ed Tyrrell, who grants them. This is a supervisor-subordinate or requester-approver relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Darlene assists Alex with booking travel logistics (flights, hotels) per Alex's requests for the investigation team.
Darlene informs Ed Tyrrell of budget issues (hotel over per diem) to get his approval for exceptions.
Both are members of the Epstein investigation team who travel together for interviews, as referenced in multiple trip requests.
Both are members of the Epstein investigation team who travel together for interviews, as referenced in multiple trip requests.
Both are mentioned as potential travel pairs for investigation trips to West Palm Beach and Los Angeles.

events.description: Prior travel for a victim interview in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel for meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document reveals active investigation travel by the SDNY Epstein team as late as January/February 2020, including an international trip to Stockholm, Sweden for an interview.
The investigation is referred to by case number '2018R01618' and as 'United States v. Epstein, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The team routinely requested and used hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews during their travel.
Travel logistics show coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys (Alex, Alison, Maurene), a legal assistant (Darlene Alleyne), and an approving official (Edward Tyrrell).
The email chain references multiple prior domestic trips in 2019 for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach, indicating a sustained investigative effort.
